body:
@ananno 
Because original `darknet` and `yolov2` use  `He initializer`,  `kernel_initializer` of `darknet()` is
fixed.
And `conv2d()` can change `kernel_initializer`. What is problem ?

> @ananno
> Because original `darknet` and `yolov2` use `He initializer`, `kernel_initializer` of `darknet()` is
> fixed.
> And `conv2d()` can change `kernel_initializer`. What is problem ?

@ruimashita San:
I understand that `darknet` use the `kernel_initializer` in function `darknet` defined in `lmnet/lmnet/blocks.py`. But it use the `kernel_initializer` via `conv2d` layer. As I showed in the code block above, current implementation of `code2d` function doesn't pass `kernel_initializer` argument into the `tf.layers.conv2d` function. Please check the 2nd code block above. 

Am I misunderstanding? :thinking:

issue.title: Kernel Initializer issue

repository.name: blueoil
repository.description: Bring Deep Learning to small devices

issue.body:
<!--- 👉👉👉 Provide a general summary of your changes. 👈👈👈 -->
To fix the kernel initializer issue in function `conv2d` in `lmnet/lmnet/layers.py`.

## Motivation and Context
<!--- 💭💡💭 Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? 💭💡💭 -->
<!--- 🔗 If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. 🔗 -->
The argument definition of `kernel_initializer` of the function `conv2d` in `lmnet/lmnet/layers/layers.py` has never been passed into `tf.layers.conv2d` function call resulting it not effective even if it is passed from the calling function. This change is necessary to pass the parameters in `tf.layers.conv2d` function by defining and passing arguments like `kernel_initializer` or `kernel_regularizer` etc.

## Description
<!--- 📝🎯📝 Describe your changes in detail. 📝🎯📝 -->
The `kernel_initializer` argument is defined in the function argument of `conv2d` but never passed in `tf.layers.conv2d` function in the code body. This results to not passing the kernel regularizer defined or passed by the calling function. 

The fix is very simple. By removing the argument definition in `conv2d` function in `lmnet/lmnet/layers/layers.py` file. The defined argument like `kernel_initializer` or any others supported by `tf.layers.conv2d` function can be automatically passed via `*args, **kwargs`.

Details discussion on this is documented in issue [here](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/issues/362).

## How has this been tested?
<!--- 🙆👌🙆 Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. 🙆👌🙆 -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, details of your manual tests, snippet code or commands of your manual tests, table of experiments results metrics, tests ran to see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
<!--- If you have experiments report documents please link to here. -->
From the code it is obvious that the argument definition of `kernel_initializer` in `conv2d` function has never been used.

## Screenshots (if appropriate):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3903030/61017452-3a681180-a3ce-11e9-8168-4001adcc2a9e.png)

## Types of changes
<!--- 🏁🎌🏁 What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: 🏁🎌🏁 -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature / Optimization (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

## Checklist:
<!--- ✅✅✅ Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. ✅✅✅ -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

<!--- TODO(wakisaka): After decide our code style, add this.
- [x] My code follows the code style of this project.
-->
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.

body:
@ananno 
Oh, thanks, I understand ❗️❗️
The `conv()` in `layers.py` has `kernel_initializer` parameter, but it is not apply to `tf.layers.conv2d()` in order to bug. 
Your typo of `conv2D` and `kernel_regularizer` and `code2d` made me confuse, But you are right 👍  

In your `Solution` code, `kernel_initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer()` parameter is  deleted from `conv()`, I wonder default `kernel_initializer` of `tf.layers.conv2d` is same as `tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer()` ? 🤔

I remember this issue. default `None` should be `tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer()`. I think we should use `tf.contrib.layers.variance_scaling_initializer()` as default like this [commit](https://github.com/LeapMind/lmnet/pull/209/commits/f900681a28c9d8dcd4202d89f12a45b36516a019).

> @ananno
> Oh, thanks, I understand exclamationexclamation
> The `conv()` in `layers.py` has `kernel_initializer` parameter, but it is not apply to `tf.layers.conv2d()` in order to bug.
> Your typo of `conv2D` and `kernel_regularizer` and `code2d` made me confuse, But you are right +1
> 
> In your `Solution` code, `kernel_initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer()` parameter is deleted from `conv()`, I wonder default `kernel_initializer` of `tf.layers.conv2d` is same as `tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer()` ? thinking

@ruimashita San:
In the tensorflow code the default `kernel_initializer` is `None`. If you recommend I can provide `xavier_initializer` by default. Should I?

> In the tensorflow code the default kernel_initializer is None. If you recommend I can provide xavier_initializer by default. Should I?

@ananno Yes. Please provide `xavier_initializer()` by default, Thanks 👍

> > In the tensorflow code the default kernel_initializer is None. If you recommend I can provide xavier_initializer by default. Should I?
> 
> @ananno Yes. Please provide `xavier_initializer()` by default, Thanks +1

@ruimashita san: I did it.
